intro: Melicope nishimurae, commonly known as Nishimura's melicope, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands, specifically found on the island of Maui. The plant is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats, often in rainforest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
